article.paragraph: RefimproveFebruary 2013Belgian hip hop musichas a fewrappersstemming fromAfricaandItaly.cite webhttp://www.mtviggy.com/articles/artist-of-the-week-congolese-belgian-rapper-baloji/Artist of the Week: Congolese-Belgian Rapper Baloji!Mtv Iggy2011-01-112014-02-25Belgium, likeFrance, controlledAfricancountries like theDemocratic Republic of the Congo(formerly Zaire),Rwanda, andBurundiuntil the early 1960s. Like in France,Immigrationimmigrantsfrom these countries started to study and live inBelgium.

The Belgianhip hop musichip hopscene started in the late 1980s with a U.S.-basedtechno musictechno/hip hop group calledTechnotronic. In the group was an emcee namedYa Kid Kfrom theDemocratic Republic of the Congowho later led the group into international fame with hits like "Pump up the Jam" and "Shake That Body". In 1990, she also joined the group Hi-Tek 3 who were heard on theTeenage Mutant Ninja Turtlesmoviesoundtrack.

However, the first major pop rapper from Belgium wasBenny B, who had a very mainstream and commercial sound. According to the European Music Office's report onMusic in Europe, this was the first of many pop acts that helped inspire a backlash and the creation of an underground hip hop scene.
